item.title: Hacker News Top Stories: Friday, March 28, 2025 at 8:20 PM UTC
item.description:
1. We hacked Gemini's Python sandbox and leaked its source code (at least some) (205 points | 48 comments)
2. Xee: A Modern XPath and XSLT Engine in Rust (196 points | 104 comments)
3. Show HN: Hexi – Modern header-only network binary serialisation for C++ (44 points | 16 comments)
4. How Kerala got rich (221 points | 125 comments)
5. The Art of DJing: Avalon Emerson (16 points | 3 comments)
6. Decomposing a Factorial into Large Factors (86 points | 19 comments)
7. Disk I/O bottlenecks in GitHub Actions (72 points | 44 comments)
8. The Real Book (2021) (51 points | 8 comments)
9. How to Write Blog Posts that Developers Read (206 points | 78 comments)
10. SignalBotOne – Notification Webhooks for Signal (20 points | 8 comments)
11. Cross-Platform P2P Wi-Fi: How the EU Killed AWDL (141 points | 78 comments)
12. Superhyperbola (14 points | 7 comments)
13. Getting hit by lightning is good for some tropical trees (109 points | 53 comments)
14. Building Statically Linked Go Executables with CGO and Zig (66 points | 10 comments)
15. The Biology of B-Movie Monsters (2003) (42 points | 27 comments)
16. Architecture Patterns with Python (383 points | 94 comments)
17. A cretaceous fly trap? Remarkable abdominal modification in a fossil wasp (6 points | 2 comments)
18. Show HN: Cursor IDE now remembers your coding prefs using MCP (64 points | 25 comments)
19. MilliForth-6502: The smallest Forth real programming language for 6502 (85 points | 13 comments)
20. Giant, fungus-like organism may be a completely unknown branch of life (266 points | 115 comments)
21. Things I would have told myself before building an autorouter (339 points | 95 comments)
22. PermitFlow (YC W22) Is Hiring Senior/Staff Engineers in NYC ( | hide)
23. Tracing the thoughts of a large language model (927 points | 321 comments)
24. How to Use Em Dashes (–), En Dashes (–), and Hyphens (-) (569 points | 429 comments)
25. A note on the USB-to-PS/2 mouse adapter that came with Microsoft mouse devices (342 points | 109 comments)
26. I asked police to send me their public surveillance footage of my car (438 points | 347 comments)
27. I tried making artificial sunlight at home (540 points | 217 comments)
28. Japanese scientists create new plastic that dissolves in saltwater overnight (117 points | 74 comments)
29. Moiré Than Meets the Eye: Uncovering the Quantum Potential of Phasons (15 points | 2 comments)
30. Entropy Attacks (73 points | 17 comments)
